channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vandalised 'No Entry' sign – 1) black graffiti on white horizontal bar on sign + 2) sign appears to have been twisted on top of post & so pointing in wrong direction. Sign is legible (despite graffiti) – but is pointing the wrong way., 3rd April
item.description:
Junction of Lower High Street and Bennington Street, Cheltenham – next to dual-slot red letterbox opposite F.Hinds Jewellers ('Centre Stone'). What3Words location = tinsel.remit.shot.

item.title: Poor repair is leading to a new pothole developing., 3rd April
item.description:
This pothole was reported as closed on 28th March 2024 (last week). Previously reported under Enquiry Number: 22044788. From the two photos take on 1 and 3rd April it is obvious that the repair is totally inadequate as poor quality ashphalt has been used with no water seal present to existing surface. A large hole is developing in the repair. The contractor has not done their job effectively and should return and carry out a proper repair. Disappointing to see that following a week of work with traffic lights and barriers, leading to delays, the job is shown to be ineffective and poorly engineered. It should also be noted that all the gravel released from the deteriorating roadway is present in the gutters leading to potential damage to car windscreens and blocked drains. Is there not a system in place to audit /check contractor workmanship as this repair lasted two days! Poor value for money. A disappointed taxpayer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 3rd April
item.description:
Today whilst walking near Hunting Butts Farm, Prestbury we saw a sign notifying that the landowner had made deposit under Section 15(A) of the Commons Act 2006. On searching your register of landowner statements and depositions, the only relevant entry I could find for the location of the notice was File Reference 801, which is indicating as Lapsed. I did, however, notice that this deposition shows the Public Footpath marked as further south-east than it should be (see attached and highlighted) Please could you explain the current status of this deposition, and confirm that their is no application lodged to modify the right of way?
Report on FixMyStreet
